text: {{Infobox writer | name = John Ehle | image = | imagesize = | birth_name = John Marsden Ehle, Jr. | birth_date = | death_date = | birth_place = Asheville, North Carolina, U.S. | death_place = Winston-Salem, North Carolina, U.S. | alma_mater = University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill | occupation = Novelist | nationality = American | period = 1957–2018 | genre = Historical fiction, Southern literature, Non-fiction | spouse = | children = Jennifer Ehle }} John Marsden Ehle, Jr. (December 13, 1925 – March 24, 2018) was an American novelist. He was known best for his fiction set in the Appalachian Mountains of the American South. He wrote the screenplay of The Journey of August King, a movie that is based on his book. He was known for his book The Winter People (1982) and Last One Home (1984). Ehle died in Winston-Salem, North Carolina on March 24, 2018 of congestive heart failure at the age of 92. ==References== ==Other websites== * Inventory of the John Ehle Papers, 1942-1993, in the Southern Historical Collection, UNC-Chapel Hill * Biography of John Ehle at the North Carolina Literary Hall of Fame * Category:1925 births Category:2018 deaths Category:Deaths from congestive heart failure Category:American military personnel of World War II Category:American novelists Category:American screenwriters Category:Writers from North Carolina Category:People from Asheville, North Carolina
